message:
Alright, So we just released our Full Javascript Stack and it's all Public! :) 

Neon (Ne) is a javascript Class system: http://azendal.github.io/neon/

Borium is a simple library to enqueue jobs and execute them in the background.: http://getborium.com/

Error monitoring for Neon: http://freshout-dev.github.io/lithium/

Metriclient - Flexible event and error reporting server: http://freshout-dev.github.io/metriclient/

flow based programing abstraction: http://freshout-dev.github.io/fluorine/

Colored, Nesting, Multiple logging management.: http://benbeltran.github.io/cobalt/

Hady Ahmed Mohammad Tayseer Emad Elsaid
story: Mohamed Alaa El Din shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Neon.js
caption: azendal.github.io
description: Neon (Ne) is a javascript Class system designed to wrap up object oriented logic around Javascript objects (which are not truly OO), and to establish a common base language for developers using such classes.

data.message: Awesome sauce! Gonna have a look at them in the morning and man, this neon retro logo, dope.
Well I can invite the Creators of this libraries if any of you guys have any question :)

Dude Fluorine is fuckin awesome! We used it in a very complex app that depends on polling and it's the fuckin coolest thing!

and advice if you will use it is to make first a graph of all your flow and then start writing the code :)

Mohammad Tayseer another trick is when you create your flow you can export it to a dot file which contains a graph of your flow :)

And in your browser console run `flow.toDot()`

it will give you an output and an instruction on how to create your svg graph of your flow :)
